text: The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.
When I saw a very disagreable scene.
When I passed an exam.
When they threatened me with a knife to take my money.
When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.
When my dog died.
When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.

I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.   á
When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.
When two drug addicts tried to take away my money.
When I saw my brother being attacked and I could not do anything.
When a class-mate died.

When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not done á
and did not do anything to defend me.

I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's á
difficulty.

When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls, á
because my car had broken down.

When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration, á
simply because the child had been leaning against a window.

A friend of mine who was driving a car ahead of me died in a á
car accident.
When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.

When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good á
one.

We were in the country and I walked away from the others one á
night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was á
not able to see what it was.

When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to á
stay up all night for the fair in my town.

When summer is over and I have to leave the town where I spend my á
holidays.

When I saw several people washing their car with water from a á
drain.

When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a á
baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some á
roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like á
that.

I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part á
very well but did not know the second part.
When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a á
man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and á
asked me to cure him myself.

An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expenses á
paid.
A film on zombies.

When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively á
with referance to sex.

I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him á
and and my Easter holidays.

When after a storm in the country, I left my shelter and saw a á
big, fat, slimy green toad by my side.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knife á
and stole all my money.

When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for á
an exam inside it and they got all mixed up.
When my mother was operated.
When I see pornographic films.

My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all á
very worried but it was successful.

I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.  I was á
rather afraid because I was alone.

An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by á
a group of louts.

A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place á
which was 1 metre high.

On the road there was a dead animal with its entrails showing and á
its skull crushed.

I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she á
had obtained a grant to work in the library.

Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to á
that class.

I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who help á
each other in exams, to the professor.

I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with á
either of them, so I had to change my plans.

I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told me á
that a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because of á
an infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.
The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.

When I am alone at night after having read horror stories, and á
then I heard unexplainable noises.
A typical family argument.
The disqualification of two of my mates in the military service.
The sight of vomit on the street.
When I pass an exam.
Continous fear of a nuclear war.

When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers á
wandering around, doing nothing.
When someone in my family died.
To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.

I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to á
study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had á
passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in á
my hometown.

I was in Sierra Nevada, climbing a peak over 3,000 metres high, á
without any light and with many other problems.  I was afraid for á
my life.

I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me.  á
Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem a á
lot.

When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was á
about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.
The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.

I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. á
 I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we á
went there because we knew we would meet there.

I was walking in the countryside alone when I came across two á
dogs who began barking at me.  I did not know whether they were á
tied up or loose, but I was afraid of them approaching me.

I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at á
the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control á
myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger á
on her as she did not obey me.

My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing á
heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it á
deep into her hand.

I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in very á
bad taste.

A friend of mine suggested that I become a film extra.  The idea á
seemed very funny to me and my reaction seemed rather outlandish á
to the others.

One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I was á
interested.  On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I had á
not expected) and went back home without seeing the film.

When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an á
hour for the next one.
When I knew I had to go out with my mother on some errands.

I saw in an ice-cream kiosque a cockroach walking through a á
cornet.

When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go á
there, if I wished, in Summer.
When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.

In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I á
played very badly.

When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit á
suicide.
A TV program on whale-hunting.

When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I á
had taken this test.
When my mother was robbed in a shop.

I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my á
ability or my knowledge of the subject.

When I saw the film "Johnny got his gun" which deals with the á
consequences of the Vietnam war.

Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something á
funny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl's á
face.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with the á
sensation that there was someone in my room.
When my brother was held up and robbed.
When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.
When I see someone vomitting.

I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long á
time.

I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip á
together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was á
afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as á
a failure.

A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to á
justify a wrong action.

I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to á
cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a á
long time.

During lunch with some classmates, a priest was also there.  He á
was eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plate á
away.  He did it with gluttony.  He wiped his hands on his suit á
several times and it was full of crumbs.

At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not á
seen for some time

Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to á
give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to á
bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.

When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking á
out of the glass.

I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have á
been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went á
to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great á
the distance between us was.

They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some á
awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that á
she loves me.

I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for á
my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.

We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were á
watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering á
me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  á
by hitting one of them.

[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back á
home, I felt very sad.]

Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.  It was in a á
friend's country house and there was nobody there to help me.
A party I went to last Christmas.
When my mother had a nervous illness.
During my last exam.
When I had to come back from my village last Christmas.
One day I went to see a rather disagreeable film (X).
When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.
A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.

On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in á
which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high á
responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.

Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundings á
and into a situation of loneliness.
When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.

In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was á
complete silence.

When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were á
made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to á
do this.

When the train taking me to my military service left the station, á
on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I á
had a hard year ahead.

A situation of overt unfairness, manipulation of people and its á
consequences.

I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very á
funny.

When I was young I saw a horror film.  Then when I went to sleep, á
the film came back too my mind and the characters frighteneed my á
imagination.

In a confrontation with a person, he provoked me several times á
till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no á
disastrous consequences.
I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.

When I was reading a book.  It had nothing to do with the book á
itself but with the disagreable smell of the pages of the book.

When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making a á
journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.
It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.

When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I á
was right and she was not.

When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I á
had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.

The first time I saw a pornographic film, all that in practice is á
so beautiful but on the screen appered as something mechanical, á
irrational, disgusting and dehumanizing.

When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till    á
the tour began.

I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence á
and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed á
that they would come for me any time.

When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one á
university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon á
authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.

We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and á
said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints á
and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.

My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick á
him up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.

When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining á
low marks, but they were much higher than expected.

I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.  A man á
sitting beside me started to stroke my leg for a while, he left in á
the middle of the film.

My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and á
my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and á
ridiculous point of view made us angry.
I had failed some subjects in mathematics.

I was at the table at a French friend's house.  They served me a á
big dish with roast cauliflower and sauce.  I had to eat it.

When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned á
my love.

When I was caught by the police and was kept with a group of á
delinquents, which added to my fear of being shut up.  I was á
afraid of the people near me and the future consequences.

When I was the target of a great many insults and completely á
unfair accusations of a large group of people.
When my best friend died, at the age of 16.

When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young á
prostitute who was not older than 18.

When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very á
long time.

I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having á
injured it badly.
When I was accused of something I had not done.
A close friend died.
I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.

I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short á
time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt á
very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

I was walking with another person when a "gang" separted us and á
pushed me in to a house, hit me in the stomach and the face, then á
they left - leaving me bleeding.

A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, I á
felt hurt and disgusted.

A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me no á
attention.  She keeps up appearances but shows almost no interest á
in me.

In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation á
was disgusting in itself.

When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I á
needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.

When my relatives and I were in a car going slowly on a frozen á
road.

My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and á
saw the scene and became angry.
I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.

I visited a place in Morocco where they worked the leather.  I á
saw the skins emerged in a liquid which ressembled putrification.
When I talk to my friends.
When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.
When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.
When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.

When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and    á
his skin came peeling off.

[ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, in á
class, in the street, at home, at the table..........]

On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me á
and I did not know who they were.

When I learned that several people had died in the street due to  á
the cold weather.

When I saw in the newspapers, on the T.V, and magazines the á
chaotic situation caused by the drought and hunger in á
Mauritania.
The physical appearance of a meal.

One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I á
most wished, around me.

During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a á
bus.  When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place, á
afraid that the police would see me.

When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he á
had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should á
not have been punished for it.

A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was á
not the same as before and something had gone wrong.

When I was young, one day in the car we fell sick and ended up á
vomitting on each other.

When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of á
medicine.
Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.
[ No description.]

When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked á
quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        á
operation.
When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.
When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I á
wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.
At my grandfather's death.
Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.

When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film á
marathon I wanted to see.

We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to á
swerve and we almost got run over.

I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams á
would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to á
obtain some more information and they told me that the exams had á
already taken place.

I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid, á
telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged á
everythiing for them.
I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.
The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.

I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which á
I should not have made.

My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied á
up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had á
done nothing.

At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he á
liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had á
attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the á
bathroom on time.

When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time á
and I had lost his address and telephone number.

I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started á
chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we á
climbed up a tree.
When I saw a car run over a child, out of carelessness.

I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a á
lot for it.
When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting á
for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  á
woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I á
was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found á
him.

I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody á
in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following á
me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At á
last I arrived home.
My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.
I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.
Finding a hair in the soup.

I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had á
not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

We were camping in the mountains, and a friend and I went for a á
walk.  It was getting darker and darker and we were not sure of á
the right way back.

I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me á
and he lost it.
To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.
Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.

My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some á
problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  á
was all right.
Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told á
it to some others who were implicated in the affair.

The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back á
to University and to the exams.

There was a cat on the street.  It had been run over and its head was á
open.  We passed beside it.

Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had á
previously failed.
I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.

My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite á
my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.

When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did á
not know what would happen.

I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber á
in my cup.

One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There á
was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.

We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very á
late.  We began to hear foot steps all around us, and we could á
not find our way out.

[ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In á
addition I was asked many questions which I did not want to á
answer.]

I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not á
have the money to do it.

In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed, á
leaving a trace of blood behind, finally it entered the mouth of á
one of the actors.

It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could á
at last be with the people I wanted to see.

One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some á
strange noises which put my imagination to work.

When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a á
certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see á
that nobody cared about what was happening to me.
I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.

I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in á
Madrid.

I was watching a procession during the Holy week, and a penitent á
approached me.

My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me á
telling me how she had got drunk the last time.
[ No response.]

I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, I á
called my mother.

Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a á
long time.

I was in a camp and went out for a walk at night on my own.  I lost  á
my way and spent several hours looking for the camp.

My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was á
my sister who had done it.
[ No response.]
At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.

When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been á
very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers á
from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until á
midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports á
at the police station.

When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which á
I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more á
money to carry on studying.

The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after á
several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each á
other.

In a park near our home, a group of young people who were á
strangely dressed were seated in the middle of the street.  They á
began to eat while carressing each other.

When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished á
with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one á
which I had desired a lot.

When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous á
for me and the people close to me.

When my father made my mother go through really terrible á
situations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........

When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty, á
lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.

When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self á
interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......
On my birthday, when I was given my presents.

We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and á
suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My á
friend had to turn the car rapidly.

When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the á
wardrobe.  My brother had done it.

When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had á
failed.
When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.

The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get á
there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there, á
everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a á
wonderful time all day long.

I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be á
operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me á
in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.

A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the á
telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry á
and made the other person apologize.

A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another á
girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years á
and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not á
believe it.

I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and á
vomited.
On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.
Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that á
the one I had was out of date.
When I came back from my holidays.
When I saw an insect going up my arm.

When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a á
fortnight.

Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the á
house and came back very late.

When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and á
she was fed up with my behaviour.

When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated á
from them for about three months.
When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.

I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in á
an exam.  She told me that I had passed.

I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I á
were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise á
from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house. á
 A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this á
alley.

My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.  á
She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things á
as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that á
some of my relatives had died in an accident.

When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut á
to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which á
impressed me most.

I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not á
expected this so I was very happy.

When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports á
practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened á
but he recovered later.

I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something á
that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to á
tease me.
When my grandfather died.
When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.

When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the á
examinations she was about to take.

When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school, á
was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.

One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted á
a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.
When I was told that my uncle had passed away.

The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the á
driver made the same excuse every day.

When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       á
a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,   á
during my holidays in Monze.á

A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent á
way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about á
something.

When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by á
thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while  á
we were playing near his home.

After going through much shame, I became a Christian and á
something new happened in my heart.  Joy that overflows was á
manifest in me.

When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard      á
when it entered my room at night.

When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him á
"Mister".  I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry á
as he had belittled me.

When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of á
a sore on the leg.

When I failed the grade 7 twice and only passed it the third á
